text: Holbrook Farm is a historic farm complex located near Traphill, Wilkes County, North Carolina. The house was built about 1826, and is a vernacular two story, three bay frame dwelling with Federal style design elements. Also on the property are the contributing log granary, log spring house, a log smokehouse, a log corn crib, a frame barn, and a board-and-batten two-room school dormitory that once served the Trap Hill Institute and moved to the property in the early-20th century. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1978. ==References== Category:Farms on the National Register of Historic Places in North Carolina Category:Federal architecture in North Carolina Category:Houses completed in 1826 Category:Buildings and structures in Wilkes County, North Carolina Category:National Register of Historic Places in Wilkes County, North Carolina Category:1826 establishments in North Carolina Category:Farms in North Carolina
title: Holbrook Farm (Traphill, North Carolina)
